intro: Diasperus perakensis, commonly known as the Perak sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its flowers are often pale pink or white, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
